noun.description: A word or phrase that is peculiar to British English.
examples: this new autobiography is studded with Anglicisms like lorries, plimsolls, and doing a bunk

noun.description: A word or phrase borrowed from English into a foreign language.
examples: the French have an irritating Anglicism: un toast

origin: Mid 17th century: from Latin Anglicus, from Angli (see Angle) + -ism.
